title: The Data Compression Lens, Tokens, Propaganda, Information Entropy and Meaning
description:
Michael and Karen discuss data compression and cybersecurity as a lens to view language, memory, relationship and consciousness, and in the process stumble upon C. S. Lewis, Jordan Peterson's Maps of Meaning, and Owen Barfield. 
Propaganda  1) as a false dichotomy 2) as a Zip Bomb or a destroyer of worlds
The Mandelbrot Set as a picture of the limits of stability, the border between order and chaos in its infinite complexity
Words as containers for meaning
Owen Barfield's The History of Words (words have souls)

Michael's recent chat with Paul VanderKlay:  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s9C4VR9CyjM&t=389s

Karen's website:  https://karenwongart.com
Karen's chats with Paul VanderKlay:
https://youtu.be/HlMgGkwWUNY
https://youtu.be/ZC03aNsPHOQ

Our next convo will discuss how we can know Truth. How do we recognize falsehood? Rationalism v. Joy. The difference between the Why and the How.  How far does Apologetics take us? God's role in consciousness.
